metadata.title: CVE-2018-10323 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
The xfs_bmap_extents_to_btree function in fs/xfs/libxfs/xfs_bmap.c in theLinux kernel through 4.16.3 allows local users to cause a denial of service(xfs_bmapi_write NULL pointer dereference) via a crafted xfs image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10323` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-33-generic - 4.15.0-33.36
linux-image-4.15.0-33-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-33.36
linux-image-4.15.0-33-lowlatency - 4.15.0-33.36
linux-image-4.15.0-33-snapdragon - 4.15.0-33.36
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-33-generic - 4.15.0-33.36
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-33-lowlatency - 4.15.0-33.36
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1021-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1021.23
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1053-snapdragon - 4.15.0-1053.57
No subscription required
